comment.body: How on earth your ZeroNet instance *that* slow? Is it running on a local machine?
Even if I host my ZeroNet with tor hidden service, which all traffic routed across the Earth multiples time still faster than yours.
@Binchan: ~~Your blog link is not working, returning a 404 `Not Found 0/1EiMAqhd6sMjPG2tznkkGXxhdwFBDdeqT9/index.html`~~ Working now
@Binchan: Working now, I find out that you don't need the `location /Websocket` configuration line to run ZeroNet behind nginx.
I see. Why is it so slow tho? VPS or ISP problem?

@Binchan: First test the speed connection between you and your server by `iperf`. Then, test the VPS I/O performance, simple `dd` is enough. If your problem happens randomly, then I highly suspect that it's VPS problem.
